data.name: DuplicationDialog_Change_DetailsExpandedText
data.value:
If disabled, your files will not be protected from drive failures. You will reclaim the disk space that was used to maintain file duplication.
You can also change the number of copies that will be kept of each file.

data.name: DuplicationDialog_Change_FooterText
data.value: You can continue to use your pool normally while duplicated files are updated in the background.

data.name: DuplicationDialog_Enable_DetailsExpandedText
data.value:
If enabled, your files will remain accessible even if any single hard drive fails. Duplicated files take up twice the amount of disk space as non-duplicated files.
You can choose to protect your files from more than one drive failure at a time, but as a result each file will take up that much more disk space.

data.name: DuplicationDialog_Enable_FooterText
data.value: You can continue to use your pool normally while files are duplicated in the background.

data.name: DuplicationDialog_Enable_Text
data.value: File duplication protects your files from drive failures.

data.name: IdentifyMissingDiskDialog_Expanded_install_Scanner
data.value: You can install the latest version of the StableBit Scanner for more precise disk identification

data.name: IdentifyMissingDiskDialog_Expanded_specify_Case_Bay
data.value: Tip: You can also specify the 'Case' and 'Bay' of your drives in the StableBit Scanner for easier identification.

data.name: IdentifyMissingDiskDialog_Expanded_text
data.value:
In order to help you identify which disk is missing, you can ping all the connected disks.
For 1 minute, this will light up the disk access lights on all the connected disks to help you identify which disk is disconnected.

data.name: IdentifyMissingDiskDialog_No_info
data.value: No specific information is available about this disk.

data.name: IdentifyMissingDiskDialog_This_is_what_we_know
data.value: This is what we know about the missing disk:

data.name: LicenseProfile_Create_A_drive_pooling_application
data.value: A state of the art disk pooling application with file duplication.

data.name: ReMeasureDialog_DetailsExpandedText
data.value: Measuring the pool will start in the background and may not start immediately if the pool is busy doing something else. You can continue to use the computer normally while this takes place, including shutting it down.

data.name: ReMeasureDialog_Text
data.value: This will remeasure the contents of the pool and recompute the pool statistics.

data.name: Main_NetworkIoBoostTooltip
data.value: Network I/O boost prioritizes read requests that come from the network over all other requests, when the disk is busy.

data.name: Main_ReadStripingTooltip2
data.value: Read striping will read duplicated files from multiple hard drives at the same time in order to improve read performance.

data.name: Main_ReadTimeDuplicationTooltip2
data.value: Duplicated files are written to multiple disks at the same time, in parallel. If unchecked, files will be duplicated at night.

data.name: DuplicatedPoolTag_RealTimeTooltip
data.value: File duplication is enabled on this pool. Files are being written to multiple disks at the same time.

data.name: DuplicatedPoolTag_NonRealTimeTooltip
data.value: File duplication is enabled on this pool. Files are not being written to multiple disks at the same time. Files will be duplicated at night.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_AddAnotherDisk
data.value: You should add another disk to the pool.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_AddAnotherDisk_Expanded
data.value: There are not enough disks in the pool to maintain duplicate copies of files.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_AutoResolve
data.value: &Automatically resolve file duplication mismatches by deleting the older file parts

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_FileConflicts
data.value: You can have DrivePool automatically delete the older file part in order to resolve this conflict.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_FileConflicts_Expanded
data.value:
One or more duplicated files have mismatching file parts. One reason why this can happen is if something changed the duplicated file's parts directly on the pooled disk and not through the pool. This can also happen if a disk was altered while it was missing from the pool.
You can resolve the conflicts manually by deleting the incorrect file part from the pooled disks.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_InUse
data.value: Close any other program that may be using these files on the pool and run duplication again.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_InUse_Expanded
data.value: Changing the duplication level of a file requires a certain level of access to that file. If another program has the file open for writing, the duplication level of that file cannot be changed.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_NotEnoughDiskSpace
data.value: There is not enough disk space left on the pool to maintain duplicate copies of all the files.

data.name: DuplicationWarningsDialog_Text
data.value: There were problems checking, duplicating or cleaning up one or more files on the pool.

data.name: ServiceConnectionDataInfo_GetTrialEnterRetail
data.value: Get a trial license or enter your retail license code

data.name: ServiceConnectionDataInfo_GetTrialForNewVersion
data.value: Get a new trial license for this version or enter your retail license code

data.name: ServiceConnectionDataInfo_LicenseForDifferentVersionGetTrialEnterRetail
data.value: Your license is for a different version of the product. Get a trial license or enter your retail license code for this version.

data.name: ServiceConnectionDataInfo_NeedsTransfer
data.value: Your license needs to be transferred to this computer

data.name: ServiceConnectionDataInfo_NoValidLicense
data.value: You don't have a valid license

data.name: ServiceConnectionDataInfo_TrialExpired
data.value: Your trial license has expired. Buy a retail license to continue using this product.

data.name: Boot_ServiceFailed
data.value: The background service failed to start, try to restart the computer.

data.name: Boot_TryToRestart
data.value:
If you are having trouble connecting to the background service, try to restart the computer.
If you are having trouble connecting to a remote computer, it may be behind a firewall.

data.name: PoolOrganization_DuplicateToolTip
data.value: Re-checking duplication on the pool will verify that the correct number of copies exist for each file on the pool. This can be useful even if you don't have duplication enabled on this pool.

data.name: PoolOrganization_ReBalanceToolTip
data.value: Re-balancing the pool will reorganize the pooled files that are stored on each individual disk.

data.name: OptionsDataInfo_EnterEmail
data.value:
Enter one or more email addresses separated by commas:
(Leave blank and click OK to disable email notifications)

data.name: Main_CreatePoolInfo
data.value: Adding a disk to a pool doesn't erase or alter the existing files on that disk.

data.name: Main_NoDisksInfo
data.value: In order to create a new pool, connect a new disk to the system.

data.name: Balancing_DriveFillSettings_No_fill_above
data.value: Try not to fill a drive above:

data.name: Balancing_DriveFillSettings_Example
data.value: For example, setting 90% full / 100 GB free on a 2TB drive will prevent a drive from being filled beyond 1.9 TB (100 GB free).

data.name: Balancing_Error_resetting_to_default
data.value: Error resetting balancing settings to their defaults.

data.name: Balancing_Allow_immediate_balancing
data.value: Allow balancing plug-ins to force immediate balancing (regardless of the automatic balancing setting).

data.name: Balancing_If_the_balancing_ratio_falls_below
data.value: If the balance ratio falls below:

data.name: Balancing_Or_if_this_much_data_needs_to_be_moved
data.value: Or if at least this much data needs to be moved:

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Move_duplicated_damaged
data.value: Move duplicated files out of damaged drives

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Move_duplicated_warning
data.value: Move duplicated files out of drives with S.M.A.R.T. warnings

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Move_unduplicated_damaged
data.value: Move un-duplicated files out of damaged drives

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Move_unduplicated_warning
data.value: Move un-duplicated files out of drives with S.M.A.R.T. warnings

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_No_new_files_on_hot_drives
data.value: Try not to place new files on drives that have exceeded their maximum temperature

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Unless_others_are_full
data.value: Unless all the other drives are this full

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Works_with_Scanner
data.value: This balancer works together with the StableBit Scanner (version 2.2 and above).

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Files_on_evacuated_drives
data.value: Allow file placement on evacuated drives if the other drives are this full:

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_No_files_on_evacuated_drives
data.value: Never allow file placement on evacuated drives

data.name: ComputerBar_ToolTip
data.value: Manage a different computer running StableBit DrivePool.

data.name: Boot_InvalidCredentials
data.value: '{0}' is not authorized to connect to this computer. You must be an Administrator on the destination computer in order to manage it.

data.name: Boot_InvalidRemoteLicense
data.value: The license on the remote machine is not activated. Log into the machine locally to activate the license.

data.name: Boot_LogInAs
data.value: Log in as a different user...

data.name: RemoveOptions_ForceRemoval
data.value: Force damaged drive removal (unreadable files will be left on the disk).

data.name: DiskItem_ClickToRemove
data.value: Click to show remove options. SHIFT+Click to begin removing with default options.

data.name: FilePerformance_FilePerformance
data.value: No disk activity on the pool.

data.name: Boot_SerializationError
data.value:
StableBit DrivePool can't load some of the data coming from the remote computer.
If the remote computer has plug-ins installed, please make sure that the same plug-ins are installed on this computer as well.

data.name: Boot_SerializationErrorTitle
data.value: StableBit DrivePool can't load some of the data coming from the remote computer.

data.name: PerFolderDuplication_DuplicationDisabled_Tooltip
data.value: Files are not duplicated in this folder.

data.name: PerFolderDuplication_DuplicationEnabled_Tooltip
data.value: Files are duplicated in this folder.

data.name: PerFolderDuplication_Inheriting_Tooltip
data.value: This folder is inheriting its duplication level from the parent folder. Changing the duplication level of the parent folder will affect it and all the other subfolders that are inheriting that duplication level.

data.name: DuplicationDialog_Enable_HowManyCopies
data.value: How many copies would you like to keep of each file?

data.name: DuplicationDialog_Enable_ProtectMe
data.value: Protect my files from more than one drive failure at a time.

data.name: PoolConditionDataInfo_Duplication_WorkingOnPool
data.value: Working on the entire pool.{0}Now processing: {1}

data.name: PoolSelectionBar_NoDriveLettersAssignedTooltip2
data.value: This pool has no drive letter assigned to it and it's not part of another pool. Pools without a drive letter may not be accessible to other applications.

data.name: FirstPoolCreated_About1
data.value: Your new pool starts off empty.

data.name: FirstPoolCreated_About2
data.value: Just copy some files to it and use it just like any other drive.

data.name: FirstPoolCreated_About3
data.value: If you ever run out of disk space, then just add another disk to the pool.

data.name: FirstPoolCreated_About4_2
data.value: Existing files are not automatically added to the pool.

data.name: FirstPoolCreated_Created
data.value: You've just created your first pool.

data.name: DiskItem_ClickToRemoveMissing
data.value: Click to remove the missing disk.

data.name: BootTimeLogging_DetailsExpandedText
data.value: Boot time logging will create log files detailing StableBit DrivePool's startup activity. The log files are not written in a human readable format (WPP) and should be submitted to technical support for analysis.

data.name: BootTimeLogging_Reboot_Text
data.value: Reboot the computer now to generate a log file.

data.name: BootTimeLogging_Text
data.value: On the next reboot, a log file will be generated in {0}.

data.name: Main_EnableFileSystemTracingToolTip
data.value: File system logging will create log files detailing StableBit DrivePool's pooling file system activity. The log files are not written in a human readable format (WPP) and should be submitted to technical support for analysis.

data.name: Balancing_AddRule_Content
data.value:
Enter a file pattern matching rule. ? matches any single character, * matches zero or more characters.
For example: "*.txt" or "\Users\*\Downloads\*"

data.name: Balancing_FilePlacement_Settings_NoOverflow
data.value: Never allow files to be placed on any other disks.

data.name: Balancing_FilePlacement_Settings_Note
data.value: Any files matching this rule will be stored on the selected drives.

data.name: Balancing_FilePlacement_Settings_YesOverflow
data.value: Allow files to be placed on other disks if all the selected disks are this full:

data.name: Balancing_FilePlacement_PatternExists
data.value: A rule with this pattern already exists.

data.name: DiskItem_FileTag
data.value: File placement balancing rules need to be applied.

data.name: Balancing_BalancersRespectFileRules
data.value: Balancing plug-ins respect file placement rules.

data.name: Balancing_BalancersRespectFileRules_Tooltip
data.value: When checked, balancing plug-ins will not violate file placement rule limits.

data.name: Balancing_FileMoverViolatesFilePatternLimitsOnDriveEmpty
data.value: Unless the drive is being emptied.

data.name: Balancing_FileRulesRespectLimits
data.value: File placement rules respect real-time file placement limits set by the balancing plug-ins.

data.name: Balancing_FileRulesRespectLimits_Tooltip
data.value: One or more balancers can set real-time file placement limits on one or more of your disks (for example, when the StableBit Scanner balancer is evacuating one or more disks). When this is checked, file placement rules will not violate those limits.

data.name: PoolOrganiationDataInfo_FilePlacementNotMoved
data.value: Files could not be moved to satisfy file placement rules ({0}) during the last balancing pass.

data.name: BalancingWarnings_FilePlacementNotMoved
data.value: {0} ({1:0,#} B) could not be moved because a suitable destination could not be found. Make sure that you have enough disk space in order to satisfy your file placement rules and that they're not conflicting with other balancing settings.

data.name: ResetAllSettings_DetailsExpandedText
data.value:
This will reset all settings and application state to the default, including the balancing settings. It will not affect your duplication settings or your pooled data.
The StableBit DrivePool service will restart and your pools will be remeasured and rechecked for consistency.

data.name: ResetAllSettings_Text
data.value: Reset all appliaction settings and application state to the default?

data.name: Balancing_FilePlacement_Settings_NewDrivesRule
data.value: When a new drive is added to the pool, files matching this rule should be placed on that drive.

data.name: SendTestEmailDialog_BeingSentTo
data.value: Your test email is being sent to "{0}".

data.name: SendTestEmailDialog_Details
data.value:
Test emails are sent instantly, but it may take a few minutes for the email to propagate. If you don't receive the test email, check your Spam folder, it may have been filtered out by your Spam filter.
All emails from StableBit DrivePool will contain the text "[StableBit DrivePool]" in the subject.

data.name: SendTestEmailDialog_FailedSend
data.value: The test email could not be sent to "{0}".

data.name: SendTestEmailDialog_SuccessfullySent
data.value: The test email has been successfully sent to "{0}".

data.name: SendTestEmailDialog_Text
data.value: Would you like to send a test email message to "{0}"?

data.name: Main_BypassFiltersTooltip
data.value:
In order to increase performance of the pool, file system "filters" that are active on each individual drive that is part of the pool can be bypassed. For example, if you have a real-time anti-virus scanner installed, this will prevent double or triple scanning of the same file when it is accessed from the pool. The file will only be scanned once.
This can cause compatibility issues with software that is designed to perform on the fly data manipulation. Data deduplication software and data encryption software are 2 examples of such software.

data.name: PoolChartDataInfo_CapacityCorrectedInfo
data.value: * Based on total file sizes. Actual disk space used may be less.

data.name: RemoveOptions_ForceClose
data.value: Force close any open unduplicated files on the drive being removed.

data.name: FilesInUseOnRemove_Info
data.value: Close the applications that have these files open and try removing the drive again. Alternatively, choose "Force close any open unduplicated files..." on the drive removal dialog to force these files to close.

data.name: FilesInUseOnRemove_SubTitle
data.value: Some files are in use and cannot be moved

data.name: Main_VerifyAfterCopyToolTip
data.value: After a file is copied due to some background process, like file balancing or background duplication, it will be read back in and checked for consistency. Enabling this option will have a negative impact on the performance of background file copy operations.

data.name: IdentifyMissingDiskDialog_CloudDrive
data.value: This drive was created by StableBit CloudDrive.

data.name: Main_EnableServiceTracingToolTip
data.value: Service tracing will create log files detailing StableBit DrivePool's service activity. The log files are written in a human readable format and can be submitted to technical support for analysis. The log files are written to: %PROGRAMDATA%\StableBit DrivePool\Service\Logs\Service

data.name: Main_TracingToolTip
data.value: Controls the level of log tracing for each module. Log messages are written to log files in %PROGRAMDATA%\StableBit DrivePool\Service\Logs\Service.

data.name: DiskToolTipDictionary_OtherCloudPool
data.value: This is a pool that consists entirely of cloud drives.

data.name: ToggleDriveLettersDialog_AssignDetails
data.value:
Assigning a drive letter to your pool makes it visible to Windows File Explorer and lets most other Windows applications access its contents.
Windows has a limited total number of drive letters available. Once all of them are used up, new pools will not have drive letters assigned to them automatically.

data.name: ToggleDriveLettersDialog_AssignText
data.value: Assign a drive letter to your pool.

data.name: ToggleDriveLettersDialog_RemoveDetails
data.value:
Removing the drive letter from your pool makes it invisible to Windows File Explorer and most other Windows applications.
Windows has a limited total number of drive letters available. Once all of them are used up, new pools will not have drive letters assigned to them automatically.

data.name: ToggleDriveLettersDialog_RemoveText
data.value: Remove the drive letter from your pool.

data.name: Options_ForcedUpdateCheck
data.value: An update check was scheduled. You will be notified shortly if any updates are found.

data.name: RecheckDuplicationDialog_Text
data.value: This will force a recheck of file duplication across all of the pools.

data.name: ModelConverter_ChangeDuplicationOfPool
data.value: Change duplication of pool "{0}" to x{1:#,0}.

data.name: ModelConverter_ChangeDuplicationOfOnTo
data.value: Change duplication of "{0}" on "{1}" to x{2:#,0}.

data.name: ModelConverter_CheckPoolMetadataDuplicationConsistencyOn
data.value: Check pool metadata duplication consistency on "{0}".

data.name: ModelConverter_EnsureFileDuplicationConsistencyOnIn
data.value: Ensure file duplication consistency on "{0}" in "{1}".

data.name: ModelConverter_SendTestEmail
data.value: Send a notification test email to "{0}".

data.name: ModelConverter_DriverVerifierEnabled
data.value: Driver verifier is enabled for CoveFS.sys. This should only be used for testing purposes and can severely degrade pool performance.

data.name: OptionsDataInfo_NotAValidEmail
data.value: "{0}" is not a valid email address.

data.name: PoolDataInfo_ThisPoolIsPartOfPool
data.value: This pool is part of pool {0}

data.name: TaskExtensions_CannotStartTask
data.value: Cannot start task "{0}", object no longer in store.

data.name: ModelConverter_UpdateAvailableText
data.value: An update is available to StableBit DrivePool (version {0}).

data.name: CloudTip_SyncApps
data.value: Synchronizing with other apps connected to your StableBit Cloud account.

data.name: OptionsDataInfo_CloudEmailEnabled
data.value: StableBit Cloud email notifications enabled. Local email functionality is not available.

data.name: Balancing_ScannerSettings_Evacuation_Immediate
data.value: File evacuation starts immediately after a problem is detected.

data.name: Balancing_ConfirmReset
data.value: Reset balancing settings to their defaults?

data.name: RemoveOptions_NoDelete
data.value: Leave pooled file copies on the removed drive (archival remove).
